metadata.feature_description: Provides connector metadata including name, icon, category for display in the connectors management UI

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify connector appears in Marketing category

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Connectors in the admin panel
steps.expected: Connectors management UI loads and displays Google Tag Manager connector
steps.actual: Connectors UI loaded successfully, Google Tag Manager connector visible in the list. Code confirms Type => ConnectorCategories.Marketting (Marketing category)

steps.action: Locate Google Tag Manager in the Connectors list and verify icon
steps.expected: Google Tag Manager icon (blue/teal diamond shape) should be visible next to the connector name
steps.actual: Blue diamond icon (Google Tag Manager logo) displays correctly next to the connector name

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Google Tag Manager display name

steps.action: Verify the display name shown for the connector in the UI
steps.expected: Display name should show 'Google Tag Manager'
steps.actual: Display name shows 'GOOGLE TAG MANAGER' (uppercase styling in UI, matching the code's DisplayName property value of 'Google Tag Manager')

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test connector doesn't support multiple instances

steps.action: Click Edit on the Google Tag Manager connector to open the edit panel
steps.expected: Edit panel should open with configuration fields
steps.actual: Edit panel opened showing Container ID field with value 'GTM-P7RJMM' and Google Analytics toggle option

steps.action: Check for Add button or option to create multiple instances
steps.expected: No Add button should be present (SupportsMultiple = false)
steps.actual: Only Cancel and Save buttons are present. No Add, Plus (+), or 'Create Another' button exists, confirming the connector does not support multiple instances

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify connector is not an Engage connector

steps.action: Verify the connector appears in the general Connectors list, not in an Engage-specific section
steps.expected: Google Tag Manager should appear in the general Connectors list under Settings > Connectors (IsEngageConnector = false)
steps.actual: Google Tag Manager appears in the general Connectors list alongside other non-Engage connectors (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.). It is not in any Engage-specific section, confirming IsEngageConnector = false

observations: The UI displays connectors in a flat list without visible category headers like 'Marketing'. However, the code confirms Type => ConnectorCategories.Marketting, meaning the connector IS categorized as Marketing internally even though the UI doesn't display category labels visually.
The connector name displays in uppercase styling (GOOGLE TAG MANAGER) in the UI, though the code property is 'Google Tag Manager'.
